javadoc:
This command will create a data of type dataType at the given address.  This
 command will only work for fixed length dataTypes.  If there are any existing
 instructions in the area to be made into data, the command will fail.  Existing data
 in the area may be replaced with the new dataType (with optional pointer conversion).  
 If the existing dataType is a pointer, then
 the existing data will be changed into a pointer to the given dataType.  If the given dataType
 is a default-pointer, it will become a pointer to the existing type.
@see DataUtilities#createData(Program, Address, DataType, boolean, ghidra.program.model.data.DataUtilities.ClearDataMode)

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a command for creating data at an address.
 Simple pointer conversion will NOT be performed.

params.name: addr
params.comment:
the address at which to apply the datatype.  Offcut data
 address allowed, provided force==true.

params.name: force
params.comment: if true any existing conflicting data will be cleared

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the datatype to be applied at the given address.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
This is the same as #CreateDataCmd(Address, boolean, DataType) except that
 it allows the caller to control whether or not pointer conversion should be handled.

params.name: addr
params.comment:
the address at which to apply the datatype.  Offcut data
 address allowed, provided force==true.

params.name: force
params.comment: if true any existing conflicting data will be cleared

params.name: stackPointers
params.comment:
if true simple pointer conversion is enabled 
 (see DataUtilities#reconcileAppliedDataType(DataType, DataType, boolean)).

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the datatype to be applied at the given address.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a command for creating data at an address.
 Simple pointer conversion will NOT be performed and existing 
 data will not be cleared.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to apply the datatype.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the datatype to be applied at the given address.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
This is the same as #CreateDataCmd(Address, DataType) except that
 it allows the caller to control whether or not pointer conversion should be handled.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to apply the datatype.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the datatype to be applied at the given address.

params.name: isCycle
params.comment: true indicates this is from a cycle group action.

params.name: stackPointers
params.comment:
if true simple pointer conversion is enabled 
 (see DataUtilities#reconcileAppliedDataType(DataType, DataType, boolean)).

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
This constructor provides the most flexibility when creating data, allowing optional pointer conversion and
 various clearing options for conflicting data.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to apply the datatype.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the datatype to be applied at the given address.

params.name: stackPointers
params.comment:
if true simple pointer conversion is enabled 
 (see DataUtilities#reconcileAppliedDataType(DataType, DataType, boolean)).

params.name: clearMode
params.comment: indicates how conflicting data should be cleared

name: CreateDataCmd
comment:
This command will create a data of type dataType at the given address.  This
 command will only work for fixed length dataTypes.  If there are any existing
 instructions in the area to be made into data, the command will fail.  Existing data
 in the area may be replaced with the new dataType (with optional pointer conversion).  
 If the existing dataType is a pointer, then
 the existing data will be changed into a pointer to the given dataType.  If the given dataType
 is a default-pointer, it will become a pointer to the existing type.
